authors: Jenny Awford For Daily Mail Australia
description: Boy Page, 28, has been granted bail after allegedly trying to punch mother-of-two and Buffs Club manager Melissa Abdoo in Mount Isa at the weekend, which left her with life-threatening injuries.
title: Boy Allen Page who attacked Buffs Club manager Melissa Abdoo bailed
title_page: Boy Allen Page who attacked Buffs Club manager Melissa Abdoo bailed | Daily Mail Online
text:
Ms Abdoo is now in a stable condition after the alleged 'coward punch'
She was rushed to Townsville Hospital early hours of Saturday morning
The mother-of-two suffered life threatening injuries in the attack
The Buffs Club manager had allegedy denied him entry to venue
Mr Page is accused of going to strike Ms Abdoo, whose head hit concrete
He is charged with grievous bodily harm on Melissa Abdoo, 36
Boy Allen Page, 28, has been granted bail at Mount Isa Magistrates Court
A man accused who launched a one-punch attack on a Queensland mother-of-two which left her fighting for her life has been granted bail.
Boy Allan Page, 28, had allegedly tried to punch mother and Buffs Club manager Melissa Abdoo in the early hours of Saturday morning after he was refused entry to the club in Mt Isa, in Queensland's far north-west.
His alleged punched missed Ms Abdoo, police said, but the momentum flung his weight into the 36-year-old woman, causing her to fall and hit her head on concrete.
Scroll down for video
Boy Allen Page (centre), 28, has been granted bail at Mount Isa Magistrates Court on Monday on charges of grievous bodily harm. He had allegedly gone to strike mother-of-two Melissa Abdoo, 36, after the Buffs Club manager denied him entry in the early hours of Saturday morning
Mr Page, from Parkside, appeared in the Mount Isa Magistrates Court on Monday charged with causing grievous bodily harm.
He was granted bail on the condition he not have contact with the alleged victim, attend licensed premises or drink alcohol.
He made no comment when he left the court, according to Nine News.
Ms Abdoo, who was originally left with life-threatening head injuries, has improved and is in a stable condition in Townsville Hospital.
Mother-of-two Melissa Abdoo had been fighting for her life with critical conditions, but has improved and is now stable after the incident just after midnight on Saturday morning
Boy Allan Page, 28, had allegedly tried to punch the 36-year-old mother-of-two. He reportedly fled the scene (pictured running) but was caught by police within an hour. He was granted bail on Monday
CCTV footage from outside the Buffs Club shows the moment Ms Abdoo was punched in the head just after midnight on Saturday morning.
The video shows Ms Abdoo standing outside the club before she is approached by a man in a black t-shirt.
The man appears to have a conversation with the 36-year-old mother-of-two before he unexpectedly lunges forward, throwing a right-handed punch with such force that she falls to the ground.
The man then sprints away from the bar and is chased by two of the club’s security guards.
It is believed Ms Abdoo had been called to the front of the pub after security refused the 28-year-old man, alleged to be Mr Page, entry for being too drunk.
Police allege that she was talking to the man’s wife when he delivered the ‘one-strike’ attack.
‘The male person has struck her from behind to her face and chest which resulted in her head making contact with the ground,’ the Queensland Police spokesman said.
Mr Abdoo, who has worked at the venue for more than a year, was rushed to hospital and placed in intensive care.
Doctors believed there may be bleeding on her brain, however her condition has improved.
She was flown to Townsville Hospital in a stable condition on Saturday afternoon for further treatment.
She had been called to the front of pub after security refused a 28-year-old man entry for being too drunk
'The male person has struck her from behind to her face and chest which resulted in her head making contact with ground,' a Queensland Police Service spokesman said
Mount Isa Police Sergeant Ross Kirkpatrick told the Brisbane Times: ‘The gentleman was refused entry and she started a bit of a standoff where they’ve argued the point.
‘What will be alleged is he’s then struck out at the manager with a single blow and that’s knocked her to the ground and caused the head injury.’
Mr Page was arrested within an hour after he’d allegedly fled the scene.
The executive manager at Buffs Club, Karen Graham, said the mother-of-two’s family was ‘absolutely livid’.
‘It’s been a long night. We’re such a family oriented staff that we all band together and we’ll give her all our support,’ she said,
‘I guess we all feel a little hopeless at the moment, sitting and waiting and praying.’
The incident comes in the wake of public outrage over a one-punch attack in Brisbane's Fortitude Valley earlier this month that claimed the life of 18-year-old Cole Miller.
In a statement posted to their Facebook page on Sunday, Buffs Club said the man was a local member and patron of the venue.
‘Puffs Club Mount Isa wishes to advise that this or any cat of violence will not be tolerated.’
The statement said ‘no further precautionary measures could have been taken to avoid this cowardly attack’.
The community came out to a rally in Brisbane's CBD to pay tribute to the promising water polo player later on Monday.
